priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Ophthalmic Exam Test Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C117742

self.title: CDISC SDTM Ophthalmic Exam Test Name Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test names that describe findings from ophthalmic examinations.
name: Ophthalmic Exam Test Name
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Ophthalmic Exam Test Name Terminology

terms.definition: A measurement of the location, in degrees, of the flatter principal meridian on a 180-degree scale, where 90 degrees designates the vertical meridian and 180 degrees designates the horizontal meridian.
A measurement of the number of cells contained in a unit of volume.
The maximum number in a group of values that represent the cell density.
The mean number in a group of values that represent the cell density.
The minimum number in a group of values that represent the cell density.
The standard deviation in a group of values that represent the cell density.
The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation. (NCI)
The ratio of the diameter of the optic cup compared to the diameter of the optic disc. (NCI)

A measurement of the extent of defect in vision caused by a mismatch of optical power between the cylindrical and horizontal meridians, resulting in sub-optimal reflection of light onto the retina. (NCI)
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference. (NCI)
The mean number in a group of values that represent the diameter of an object.
The minimum number in a group of values that represent the diameter of an object.
The standard deviation in a group of values that represent the diameter of an object.
The position on a scale to assess hyperemia.
The fluid pressure within the eye.
The condition or state of the lens of the eye. (NCI)
A number or range of numeric values on the log scale that measures performance, function, quality, or ability.
The longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.
The integer that describes the number of letters correctly identified by the subject during an eye chart assessment.
terms.preferredTerm: Number of Correct Eye Chart Letters

terms.definition: The integer that describes the number of lines read by the subject during an eye chart assessment.
terms.preferredTerm: Number of Eye Chart Lines Read

terms.definition: A description of the action in response to some kind of stimulus.
The spatial arrangement of something as distinct from its substance. (NCI)

A measurement of the extent of defect in vision caused by a mismatch of optimal power between the cornea and/or lens and the length of the eyeball, resulting in sub-optimal reflection of light onto the retina. (NCI)
The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length.
The maximum number in a group of values that represent the thickness of an object.
The mean number in a group of values that represent the thickness of an object.
The minimum number in a group of values that represent the thickness of an object.
The standard deviation in a group of values that represent the thickness of an object.
